message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.PF, cs.MA. 

This paper deals with the study of age of information in a status updating system, which involves the transmission of time-sensitive status updates from a source node to a monitor node through a server node. The paper considers two different models: one with a Gilbert-Elliot service profile at the server node and the other with a Gilbert-Elliot sampling profile at the source node. Both of these models involve the use of Markov chains to model the behavior of the system. Given this focus on modeling and analysis of communication systems, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.PF (Performance), and cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems).
